case.name: Bayer Bioscience N.V. v Deltapine Australia Pty Ltd (No 2) [2006] FCA 1762 (15 December 2006)

citphrases.citphrase: restraining from importing distributing supplying offering for sale or selling goods of a same design and appearance
breach of ss 52 and 53 of the trade practices act 1974 (cth). evidence
need to comply with ss 76 and 79 of the evidence act 1995 (cth).

citances.sentence: As a separate matter, I should indicate that I do not accept that by reason of the operation of O 58 r 31 of the Rules of Court that the evidence sought to be introduced by the applicants on this issue (including the Falcon tests) should be rejected. The Rule would not prevent this Court from considering the Flacon tests sought to be introduced by the applicants if they otherwise complied with the requirements of the Evidence Act : see generally Bayer Bioscience NV v Deltapine Australia Pty Ltd (No.2) [2006] FCA 1762 ; (2006) 71 IPR 40 per Heerey J.

legistitles.title: EVIDENCE ACT 1995
EVIDENCE ACT 1995 - SECT 135 General discretion to exclude evidence
FEDERAL COURT RULES 1979
